metadata.Title: CVE-2023-24329 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue in the urllib.parse component of Python before 3.11.4 allows attackers to bypass blocklisting methods by supplying a URL that starts with blank characters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> there are some discussions around that issue that raises doubts about if it was properly fixed or not. till further investigation it'll be marked as needed again.

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm15').
python3.4 package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
